thread.title: Clio Announces Professional Services Partnership With CuroLegal
thread.title_full: Clio Announces Professional Services Partnership With CuroLegal - CBS News 8 - San Diego, CA News Station - KFMB Channel 8

author: cbs8
title: Clio Announces Professional Services Partnership With CuroLegal
text:
CuroLegal to offer configuration and customization to Clio-using law firms.
Vancouver, BC
Clio, the leading cloud-based legal practice management provider, is pleased to announce the addition of Professional Services to its portfolio of Clio Certified Consultant capabilities. CuroLegal, a next-generation consulting and outsourcing firm, is the first to partner with Clio in this new consulting capacity, offering the unique capability to assist law firms with software configuration and customization, on site training, data migration and custom application development.
“We’re excited to offer our customers this expanded capability,” said Jack Newton, CEO and co-founder of Clio. “Clio remains one of the most easy-to-use practice management solutions on the market but depending on the size and complexity of a firm’s practice, having access to a team of experts allows for firms to optimize their operations in a timely and efficient manner.”
Professional services capabilities include:
Expertise in law firm consulting as it relates to legal technology and cloud computing Clio account set-up, configuration, data migration (including manual migrations) and integrations Workflow and integration consulting Custom integrations (via Clio’s API and Zapier) On-site or remote training for all levels of users Long-term or on-demand support and assistance
Clio’s Certified Consultant program, especially the top-tier Gold Certified Consultants, and the newly introduced professional services partnership allows for clients to work with trusted individuals within the Clio family. The combination of these two capabilities sets Clio apart in its ability to deliver modern tools that law firms need to assist their day-to-day practice management, while simplifying their operations and helping them grow their practice.
“Curo works with lawyers to launch and grow modern practices focused on operational excellence, and Clio serves as the backbone for truly efficient and scalable firms,” said Chad Burton, CEO and co-founder of CuroLegal.
To learn more about CuroLegal, visit: http://www.curolegal.com .
ABOUT CLIO:
Clio is the most comprehensive cloud-based practice management platform for the legal industry. With the help of the cloud, Clio eases the process of time tracking, billing, administration, and collaboration for law firms of all sizes. Based in Vancouver, B.C. and launched in 2008, Clio is used by legal professionals in over 50 countries. Clio has raised $27 million from investors including Bessemer Venture Partners. “We’re thrilled to be partnering with Clio in this capacity.”
Learn more at http://www.clio.com .
Follow on Twitter @goclio.
